thread.title: “1st September – Spring Day!”

author: news24.com
title: “1st September – Spring Day!”
text:
In the Southern Hemisphere the 1 st September of every year is considered to be the dawn of a new season in our year, that of Spring.
A season that is welcomes, as it is a season of growth, blooms, leaves on the trees, jubilation in the animal surrounds, fruits in the making that is seasonable, yet in Elias Motsoaledi there appears to be no spring or even any new season for that matter.
The 1 st September 2015, came and went and in not the smallest ambit of Council, was the new season welcomed with invigoration, and or aspiration or any hope of a better life for all with a new season that has dawned upon us.
A season in which the Council could have come out of its ‘winter hibernation’ of sleeping on the job, and tackling issues and all those that have been outstanding for so long, with new will and power taken into account how they have failed dismally, yet they continue with their slumber into the dawn of Spring as long as they are being paid for while being in hibernations.
Maybe Elias Motsoaledi Council, and all of its employees should listen to the words of the song from R Kelly when he sings: “If only I could take back the hands of times” and maybe have their spring awakening sooner than later, as when they finally wake up, their coffee will be ice cold, but don’t worry, their bank balances would have benefitted substantially, so why worry in the first instance, it is just another day, another day in paradise for that matter with PRASA’s gravy train stopping ad infinitum at the station in Groblersdal right outside the offices of the Elias Motsoaledi Local Council, for all to get on, a the seats are plenty and the money coming from a bottomless pit, but note, residents and citizens of the area, have to run along the track, as there are no seats available for them on the train, so they have to just live in the winter and the hibernation of all those in Council.
